subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph: Top-ranked Rafael Nadal and No. 2 Roger Federer powered into the Madrid Masters quarterfinals, while No. 3 Novak Djokovic lost to Ivo Karlovic, 7-6 (4), 7-6 (5). Nadal moved closer to clinching the season-ending No. 1 ranking by beating Richard Gasquet, 6-4, 6-2, while Federer eased past Jo-Wilfried Tsonga, 6-4, 6-1. Federer’s victory meant that he became the ATP Tour’s career leader in prize money, topping $43.3 million to overtake Pete Sampras. ¶Top-ranked Jelena Jankovic’s 12-match winning streak ended in a second-round match that left her bruised and bleeding, a 5-7, 6-3, 6-3 loss to Flavia Pennetta at the Zurich Open. Jankovic said she was tired after winning titles the last three weeks in Tokyo; Stuttgart, Germany; and Moscow. “I didn’t have any gas in the tank,” she said. “I am not a machine.” Zurich.
